## Template Instructions

### This is a Parent Issue (PAI)

- **PLAN** and **EPIC** are root-level documents (Level 1)
- They contain the full detailed scope and all derived work
- All child issues (SPRINTs, TASKs, etc.) MUST reference this parent

### Slug Generation

The \`<Slug>\` is auto-generated from the epic title:
1. Remove special characters and stop words
2. Convert to PascalCase (max 20 chars)
3. Prefix with document type

**Examples:**
- \`Production-Ready Indexing System\` ‚Üí \`EPIC-IndexingSystem\`
- \`User Authentication Overhaul\` ‚Üí \`EPIC-AuthOverhaul\`

### Epic vs. Plan

| Type | Scope | Timeline | Use When |
|------|-------|----------|----------|
| **PLAN** | Project/release roadmap | Quarters | Managing releases, multi-team coordination |
| **EPIC** | Cross-functional feature set | 4-12 weeks | Large features spanning multiple sprints |

### Naming Convention

| Level | Type | Title Format | Content |
|-------|------|--------------|---------|
| **1 (PAI)** | EPIC | \`[EPIC] Title\` | Full detailed scope, vision, all milestones |
| **2** | SPRINT | \`[EPIC-<Slug> \| SPRINT-XXX] Title\` | Execution instructions, grouped tasks |
| **3** | TASK/BUG/FEATURE/HOTFIX | \`[EPIC-<Slug> \| SPRINT-XXX \| TYPE-NNN] Title\` | Brief technical summary |

### Linking Children

Use both methods:
1. **GitHub task list:** \`- [ ] #123\` (tracks completion)
2. **Metadata tag:** \`[parent:EPIC-<Slug>]\` in child issue body

### Key Tags (Dedupe)

Every checklist item MUST include \`[key:<ULID>]\` for canonical identity:
\`\`\`markdown
- [ ] Task title [key:01KFRBTZSPJTN6GNH4YKG3DMJP] [labels:...] [status:...] [priority:...] [estimate:...]
\`\`\`
